datafield.subfield: Superoutburst of WZ Sge-type dwarf nova below the period minimum: ASASSN-15po

We report on a superoutburst of a WZ Sge-type dwarf nova (DN), ASASSN-15po. The light curve showed the main superoutburst and multiple rebrightenings. In this outburst, we observed early superhumps and growing (stage A) superhumps with periods of 0.050454(2) and 0.051809(13) d, respectively. We estimated that the mass ratio of secondary to primary (q) is 0.0699(8) by using P_orb and a superhump period P_SH of stage A. ASASSN-15po [P_orb ∼ 72.6 min] is the first DN with an orbital period between 67–76 min. Although the theoretical predicted period minimum P_min of hydrogen-rich cataclysmic variables (CVs) is about 65–70 min, the observational cut-off of the orbital period distribution at 80 min implies that the period minimum is about 82 min, and the value is widely accepted. We suggest the following four possibilities: the object is (1) a theoretical period minimum object, (2) a binary with a evolved secondary, (3) a binary with a metal-poor (Popullation II) seconday, or (4) a binary which was born with a brown-dwarf donor below the period minimum.
